results.title: The Engineering of agreement. What would you say?
results.creator_credit: Jodie Copelan, Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: Obtaining the agreement of others is vital in the everyday work situation and in such fields as sales; the value of considering the other person’s point of view and of establishing two way communication. Two real-life interviews show the right and wrong approaches, while a trailer provides opportunities for discussing common difficulties.

results.title: The Engineer and the atom
results.brief_description: The role of engineers in a series of atomic projects, including Calder Hall, Dounreay, and the new series of stations being built for the Electricity Authority are featured. The need for new techniques in building skill, using a greater degree of precision than ever before, and new materials capable of standing up to intense strain and powerful radiation is emphasised. No other credits available.

results.title: Engine bearing manufacture
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Repco Engine Parts Group Technical Film
results.brief_description: The processes involved in the manufacture of bearings and bushes for all types of automobiles are explained. The works are in Tasmania and 600 different types of bearing sets are produced. The trade is not only within Australia, orders are received from the East. Africa, USA and Germany.

results.title: Rodin's inferno = L'enfer de Rodin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Art film on the works of the great French sculptor Rodin. The film, which has no commentary, attempts to illustrate the meeting of two dreams, that of Dante and that of Rodin. Two titles are used, one at the opening of the film, “Life … that miracle (Rodin)” and another before the Descent into Hell “Abandon hope all ye who enter here … (Dante)”. Using lighting effects and camera movement, the film brings to life the world of Rodin’s statues, working from the two principal sources of the sculptor’s inspiration, Love and Pain. His works are grouped according to the following themes:-The Creation of Man and Woman; Love and the Human Passion; Old Age; Poverty and Decay; the Descent into Hell, and the Vision of Hell

results.title: A Child in his country = Un Enfant un pays
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, Jacques Bobet, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A childhood fantasy where dreams carry a boy far to adventure. It is an animated film in a contemporary style, employing drawn backgrounds, inserts of photographs, and successions of the same pictures to suggest movement. The most animated figure is the boy. He arrives in Canada on an ocean liner and is, in turn, a hunter of polar bear, a cowboy, a hockey star, and a swimmer. (Award: Toronto.)

results.title: Energy unlimited: nuclear research at Lucas Heights
results.creator_credit: Australian Atomic Energy Commission and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The history of the Atomic Research Establishment at Lucas Heights near Sydney and a description of its work in atomic research and in producing radio-isotopes for industry and medicine. Includes the construction of the buildings; the official opening by the Prime Minister, the Rt. Hon. R.G. Menzies in 1958; the functioning of the research reactor.

results.title: Energy: the problems and the future
results.brief_description: Each of the four basic elements - water, earth, wind and fire of the sun - is a possible energy source for the future. The film shows developments in France with housing designs and tidal power.

results.title: Energy. Ep. 2. The Nuclear alternative
results.creator_credit: George McQuilkin, Anthony Morris, Jane Treiman and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Explores fission power, how it works and the controversies over safety and radioactive waste. Stresses societies’ need to develop ways of using less energy. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Energy. Ep. 1. The Dilemma
results.brief_description: Discusses past, present and future energy growth patterns. Explores problems of supply and demand, depletion of fossil fuels, our dependency and economic and social problems. Stresses societies’ need to develop ways of using less energy. Suitable for secondary level.
